bwwExcerpt: But there's no denying the ferocity and emotional precision of the cast, beginning with husky-voiced Ripley and that unearthly, unforced vibrato seeming to emanate right from the diaphragm to bypass the larynx entirely. Casual quips masking her anguish, holding back the floodgates until -- like MAdam Rose at the end of "Gypsy" -- she has to let 'er rip, this is a classic musical comedy performance of unconventional musical drama fixings.
